Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including individuals with disabilities and United States qualified protected veterans.Job Summary:
As Technical Sales Engineer, you work with engineers, architects, contractors and owners/developers in the design, application and sale of systems, controls, parts and services for commercial, industrial and institutional buildings. These systems will include the world's most complete line of commercial, industrial and institutional heating, ventilating and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment and building management controls. We seek candidates that want to become more than just a competent engineer. A career in technical sales demands excellent communication, strong interpersonal skills & relationship building, determination and rock solid confidence. You will attend The Trane Graduate Training Program (GTP) a 5-month classroom training program designed to prepare engineers for a rewarding career in technical sales. The program is geared toward developing sales engineers to sell Trane's complex heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) products and systems to commercial and industrial customers. Upon completion of the Program, you will assume responsibilities of a Sales Account Manager within a pre-assigned office location.
Started in 1926 and recognized as the industry's most comprehensive training program, the GTP provides you with intensive technical, business, sales and leadership training, with an emphasis on maintaining the highest ethical and professional standards. As a participant, you will attend lectures and technical presentations; hear about "real world" projects from visiting Trane sales engineers, managers and customers; complete challenging homework assignments; and participate in individual and team projects.
Travel

Fort Wayne, IN 46818Due to our continued phenomenal growth, we are actively seeking sales professionals to join our industry renowned team of Sales Engineers here at our headquarters in Fort Wayne, Indiana.
WHO TYPICALLY APPLIES FOR THIS JOB?
Recent graduates of a Music Technology, Audio Production or Music Business program- or alumni of these types of programs with several years experience since graduation
People with music industry experience in retail sales or as a manufacturer's rep, or who work in a recording studio or a live music venue, either as an employee or freelancer
Gear Heads: people who love talking about the latest technology with others who share their passion
Musicians: people who love performing or writing music that are now at a point in their life where they seek stability and a career (and are maybe tired of living on a tour bus or the uncertainty of "gig" money.)
WHAT DO WE LOOK FOR IN A SALES ENGINEER CANDIDATE?
Smart, empathetic folks with strong people skills
Great verbal and written communication chops
A strong knowledge, and passion for, the gear we sell
Words that describe a successful Sales Engineer: Driven, self motivated, proactive, entrepreneurial, disciplined, organized, servant mentality, patient, passionate
WHAT DOES A SALES ENGINEER DO?
We think of each Sales Engineer as their own store. The mission over time is to ultimately form a long term relationship based on trust, friendship and integrity with somewhere between 3000 to 6000 customers who now become "your" customer. Think of it as becoming a dedicated professional adviser who is a true expert in the products we sell through our amazing training program. Other duties include:
Complete our 13 week comprehensive training program for Sales Engineers, Sweetwater University. (find out more here)
Making 80-100 outbound phone calls daily to existing customers, as well as forming relationships with new ones, to assist them in making their musical dreams come true
Answering questions and giving advice on musical instruments and pro audio gear
Educating customers on a wide variety of topics such as guitar tone and amplification, digital audio recording, MIDI and sound synthesis, drums, live sound and countless other topics
Following up on orders or troubleshooting a gear issue in partnership with our Tech Support team to provide outstanding customer service
Designing sound systems or selecting gear for churches, schools, recording studios, live venues and the like
Constantly learning about new products and advising others, be they customers or team mates
Picture living in a community where it's safe to walk down the streets at night, with minimum traffic, clean air, the most affordable housing market of any city in the country, great schools, a thriving music scene, and countless other "quality of life" choices. Think about having a career you can grow with and an excellent benefits package, while receiving both the immediate and long-term satisfaction you've always wanted.
We suggest you watch the video conversation with our Sales Engineers, and then fill out our on-line application. You'll then be contacted by one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.
This could be the career in the music industry you have always dreamed of. Why wait? We'd love to take a look at your application.

Tempe, AZ3+ years experienceVersum Materials (NYSE: VSM) (versummaterials.com) is a best-in-class electronic materials company providing high-purity chemicals and gases, delivery systems, services and materials expertise to meet the evolving needs of the global semiconductor, display and LED markets. Derived from the Latin word for "toward," the name "Versum" communicates the company's deep commitment to helping customers move toward the future by collaborating, innovating and creating cutting-edge solutions.
A global leader in technology, quality, safety and reliability, Versum is one of the world's largest suppliers of next generation CMP slurries, ultra-thin dielectric and metal film precursors, formulated cleans and etching products, and delivery equipment that has revolutionized the semiconductor industry. Versum Materials operated for more than three decades as a division of Air Products. An independent company since October 2016, Versum has annual sales of about US $1.4 billion, 2,300 employees and 14 major facilities in Asia and in North America. It is headquartered in Tempe, Arizona, United States.
POSITION SUMMARY
Delivery Systems and Services (DS&S) business unit provides specialty gas and chemical delivery equipment and associated services to Versum customers in the semiconductor and related industries. As a Regional Sales Engineer for customers in the Western Region, you will be the initial point of contact to support their commercial and technical questions regarding Versum equipment and services offerings. Your focus will be to develop and maintain relationships with customers to identify opportunities where Versum can add value. Internally you will interact with a cross-functional team of other sales team members, engineering, quality, operations, and customer service on a regular basis to obtain information that you need to support customer requests. This position offers a blend of technical and commercial support and is suited well for an individual that is inquisitive, self-motivated, project-oriented, organized and interested in going beyond basic equipment quoting into how our customers use equipment to solve their problems.

Our industry offers a fast-paced environment that offers a different challenge each day. The Regional Sales Engineer must be a strong team player that can influence change and set direction. Daily tasks will range from serving as the technical lead that creates sales quotations that define an equipment solution to support customer’s requirements, acting as lead contact to engage engineering and services teams to resolve equipment field issues, or resolving account oversight activities like monitoring of PO status and accounts receivables.
Technical aptitude is a key. Supporting commercial activities within this group may require explanations of technical product/system information, actions to align equipment specifications with customer expectations, and flawless change management oversight.
PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIESDevelop quotations for capital equipment and spares opportunities for new fabs, expansions, and process changes including customer proposal, presentation and after-market support.Monitor order execution for capital equipment purchase orders to ensure scope definition is correct, manufacturing progresses on schedule and customer updates are provided in a timely manner.Support prompt closure of equipment issues by promoting and managing the interface between our internal engineering team and our customers.Manage equipment volume forecasts from customers to support the Sales and Operations process.Provide competitive feedback to Product Management team to ensure equipment and services solutions align with Customer roadmap and process needs. Identify cost savings opportunities via alternative designs and components that benefit both Versum and the Customer.Commercial lead for contract negotiations.Sales team point of contact for reporting progress and closure of customer quality notifications.Interface with customer project managers/engineers to promote and communicate equipment feature/function/benefit and project schedules.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Engineering or other BA/BS degree in technical discipline and 3-5 years industry experience.
CRITICAL SKILLSIndividual must be self-motivated, a proven problem solver and a strong leader.Ability to understand equipment technical details to align a specific product offering to meet customer requirements.Interpersonal skills are required to build and maintain successful complex relationships.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlinesMust be able to influence the internal cross functional teamAbility to inspire the confidence of Management and Customers in presentations and negotiations, and reaction to problems.Detailed investigation / troubleshooting skills.Excellent written and verbal communications skills in presentations, negotiations and problem solving.Ability to travel up to 50% of the time
PREFERRED SKILLS (to be given extra consideration)Technical knowledge and understanding of electronics specialty gas/chem equipment and applications.Prior project or construction experience installing equipmentLogical and creative thinker
Versum Materials offers a comprehensive benefits package including paid holidays/vacation, affordable medical, dental, life insurance, 401K plans.
If you are a current Versum Materials employee, please apply via online by clicking on Online Applications, then selecting Career Center.
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those applicants who are being considered for an interview, or are currently employed by Versum Materials, will be contacted.
Versum Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer (U.S.) All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, citizenship, gender, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or veteran status.

Enterprise Sales Engineer (Atlanta)

Working out of ServiceTitan's Atlanta office, the ideal Sales Engineer (SE) candidate must be a hungry self starter with a proven track record in SaaS Sales and knowledge of technology. Must be able to explain complex information and concepts in simple to understand and practical business context. The candidate will be organized and analytical, able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches. Must possess strong presentation skills and be able to communicate professionally verbally as well as in written communication.

ServiceTitan is a mobile, cloud-based software platform that helps home services companies streamline operations, improve customer service, and grow their business. job_description:
Miramar, FL 330235+ months experienceDescription:
At Ingersoll Rand we're passionate about inspiring progress around the world. We advance the quality of life by creating comfortable, sustainable and efficient environments. Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including individuals with disabilities and United States qualified protected veterans.
Job Summary:
Building on Trane's 90-year legacy of the Graduate Training Program, the Controls Graduate Training Program (CGTP) is designed to prepare Engineers for a rewarding career in Technical Sales for our expanding Energy Services business. The program is specifically geared toward developing Controls Account Managers to sell Trane's Building Advantage portfolio of services and Building Automation Systems (Controls) to commercial and industrial customers. Upon completion of the Controls Graduate Training Program, employees assume responsibilities of a Controls Account Manager in a pre-assigned location.
Held in St. Paul, MN, the CGTP provides intensive technical, business, sales and leadership training, with an emphasis on maintaining the highest ethical and professional standards. Participants will attend lectures and technical presentations; complete challenging homework assignments; partake in individual and team projects; visit local sales offices and plants; learn about real world projects from Trane sales engineers, managers and customers.
Key Elements of the Controls Graduate Training Program include:
Ingersoll Rand and Trane's history and values
Technical focus: HVAC and Controls Fundamentals
HVAC Systems and comprehensive solutions
Controls and Energy Services offeringsEnvironmental and Energy factors associated with developing HVAC and Building Automation Systems recommendations to meet customer specifications
Networking opportunities with Trane's senior sales engineers and leadership
Sales and leadership development through teamwork and project managementCGTP is a 5 month training program consisting of 14 weeks at the Trane St. Paul Controls Headquarters and 4 weeks of bridge time back in the District Sales Office.
Bridgework in the office is an essential part of the CGTP curriculum designed to help students integrate classroom and experiential learning, and key to organizational development of the Controls Account Manager role.Assignments are a mix of on-line learning, interaction with office cohorts, and assignments given by CGTP instructors.
The opportunity to attend the Controls Graduate Training Program positions students to influence the business in a critical way to become educated change agents for our organization. This selective program provides a strong foundation to start your career in technical sales, or build on your existing experience to take your career in an exciting new direction.
Responsibilities:
Convert leads into opportunities by assigning the appropriate sales process, identifying the required project team members, making assignments, and communicating the next steps in the process
Utilizes account management process to identify key customers and to develop specific action plans to grow identified accounts.
Develops relationships with multiple buying influences in the customer's organization, including project managers, project engineers, construction, purchasing, and accounts payable.
Assists customers in answering technical questions on HVAC systems, Trane products, and system application alternative, Building Automation Systems, installation, operation, maintenance, and problem resolution.
Determines needs, develops and executes an account specific business plan to identify the long term, mutual support requirements required to facilitate a strong, profitable and successful partnership.
Gathers and validates preliminary information and performs facility walkthrough, construction plan review or other requirements.
Determines project needs, constraints, and responsibilities to meet all of the customer's HVAC system design and installation requirements.
Responsible for project take-off, selection, pricing, and integration of equipment, controls, and services.Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have obtained or are currently pursuing a Bachelor's of Science in Engineering, Information Technology Systems, or technology related field
Strong oral and written communication skills with desire to impact organization revenue through sales
Strong goal orientation, highly motivated, and possess a strong desire to sell industry leading products in the market place.
Eligible for employment in the United States without sponsorship
Possess a valid state issued Driver's License with ability to provide proof of insurance and meet our successful background check requirement.
Flexibility to work outside normal work hours, as required.We are committed to helping you reach your professional, personal and financial goals. We offer competitive compensation that aligns with our business strategies and comprehensive benefits to help you live your healthiest. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture that engages as well as values the different backgrounds and experiences of our employee, which, in turn, spurs innovation, generates creative solutions and enhances our customer relations.
If you share our passion for inspiring progress-for bringing about bold shifts in how people, economies and societies operate-then you belong with Ingersoll Rand. Progress begins with you.

We are a global business committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. For more information, visit http://www.ingersollrand.com/.

Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including individuals with disabilities and United States qualified protected veterans.
Job Summary:
Trane's summer internship allows participants to experience a program focused on exploring a career in Technical Sales. Our commercial business systems interns work with Industry leading Sales Professionals and our customers in the design, application and sale of systems, controls, parts and services for commercial, industrial and institutional buildings. This includes the world's most complete line of commercial, industrial and institutional heating, ventilating and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment and building management controls. Throughout your internship at one of our nationwide sales offices, you will be exposed to the many facets of Trane's businesses: Service, Equipment, Building Automation, Application, Fulfillment and much more. You will attend sales meetings; business functions; sales and service calls; customer meetings alongside experienced account managers and mentors. You will understand the steps sales engineers take from start to finish on a job and will be hands-on in those steps throughout the internship. In addition, you will gain an appreciation for the importance of the relationship with our customers as you work with them on a daily basis as a point-of-contact creating a sense of ownership and importance in the solution-making process. Our structured twelve-week (12) program will challenge and develop your technical, business, sales, leadership and communication skills. It will give you insight into sales engineering career with Trane and create the opportunity to join our industry leading Graduate Training Program (GTP) upon graduation for those who mutually agree to pursue a career in Technical Sales.
Travel
Less than 15% in defined geography
Education Type
Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree
Qualifications:

Open to Sophomores and Juniors
Strong Oral and Written Communication skills with desire to impact organization revenue through Sales

Job Summary:
Building on Trane's 90-year legacy of the Graduate Training Program, the Controls Graduate Training Program (CGTP) is designed to prepare Engineers for a rewarding career in Technical Sales for our expanding Energy Services business. The program is specifically geared toward developing Controls Account Managers to sell Trane's Building Advantage portfolio of services and Building Automation Systems (Controls) to commercial and industrial customers. Upon completion of the Controls Graduate Training Program, employees assume responsibilities of a Controls Account Manager in a pre-assigned location.
Held in St. Paul, MN, the CGTP provides intensive technical, business, sales and leadership training, with an emphasis on maintaining the highest ethical and professional standards. Participants will attend lectures and technical presentations; complete challenging homework assignments; partake in individual and team projects; visit local sales offices and plants; learn about real world projects from Trane sales engineers, managers and customers.
Key Elements of the Controls Graduate Training Program include:
Ingersoll Rand and Trane's history and values
Technical focus: HVAC and Controls Fundamentals
HVAC Systems and comprehensive solutions
Controls and Energy Services offeringsEnvironmental and Energy factors associated with developing HVAC and Building Automation Systems recommendations to meet customer specifications
Networking opportunities with Trane's senior sales engineers and leadership
Sales and leadership development through teamwork and project managementCGTP is a 5 month training program consisting of 14 weeks at the Trane St. Paul Controls Headquarters and 4 weeks of bridge time back in the District Sales Office.
Bridgework in the office is an essential part of the CGTP curriculum designed to help students integrate classroom and experiential learning, and key to organizational development of the Controls Account Manager role.Assignments are a mix of on-line learning, interaction with office cohorts, and assignments given by CGTP instructors.
The opportunity to attend the Controls Graduate Training Program positions students to influence the business in a critical way to become educated change agents for our organization. This selective program provides a strong foundation to start your career in technical sales, or build on your existing experience to take your career in an exciting new direction.
Responsibilities:
Convert leads into opportunities by assigning the appropriate sales process, identifying the required project team members, making assignments, and communicating the next steps in the process
Utilizes account management process to identify key customers and to develop specific action plans to grow identified accounts.
Develops relationships with multiple buying influences in the customer's organization, including project managers, project engineers, construction, purchasing, and accounts payable.
Assists customers in answering technical questions on HVAC systems, Trane products, and system application alternative, Building Automation Systems, installation, operation, maintenance, and problem resolution.
Determines needs, develops and executes an account specific business plan to identify the long term, mutual support requirements required to facilitate a strong, profitable and successful partnership.
Gathers and validates preliminary information and performs facility walkthrough, construction plan review or other requirements.
Determines project needs, constraints, and responsibilities to meet all of the customer's HVAC system design and installation requirements.
Responsible for project take-off, selection, pricing, and integration of equipment, controls, and services.Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have obtained or are currently pursuing a Bachelor's of Science in Engineering, Information Technology Systems, or technology related field
Strong oral and written communication skills with desire to impact organization revenue through sales
Strong goal orientation, highly motivated, and possess a strong desire to sell industry leading products in the market place.
Eligible for employment in the United States without sponsorship
Possess a valid state issued Driver's License with ability to provide proof of insurance and meet our successful background check requirement.
Flexibility to work outside normal work hours, as required.We are committed to helping you reach your professional, personal and financial goals. Sharon Hill, PA2+ years experienceQuincy Compressor, LLC makes and sells the highest quality reciprocating and rotary screw air compressors, vacuum pumps and a full line of air treatment components. Our products are used around the world in manufacturing plants, hospitals, climate control systems and any application that requires reliable air assistance. If you're as tough, dependable and efficient as the compressors we make, then you're the right fit for Quincy Compressor. We are currently seeking a CTS Sales Engineer to join our team in Pennsylvania.
Basic Function:
At the direction of the Sales Manager, the Sales Engineer, Service will exercise primary control over all customer-related activities and problems within the assigned area. The Sales Engineer, Service will work with the Sales Manager and other factory-functional areas to complete assigned sales and marketing goals.
Nature & Scope:
The primary responsibility of the Sales Engineer, Service is to manage the direct selling activities of Quincy Service Products and define accounts located in the assigned geographical territory. The Sales Engineer, Service is to perform all assigned tasks to assure that individual and company goals are achieved in respect to maximum sales volume and profitability.
Principle Duties:
Prospecting new and drifted accounts to generate revenue
Design and engineer compressed air service solutions
Develop relationships with key accounts in assigned territory
Track customer calls and provide reports accordingly using Salesforce tool
Effectively manage quote log and follow up as needed
Work with local utility company to process rebates for energy savings
Increase rapport with customer via effective troubleshooting of service needs
Develop understanding of competitive landscape in compressor market
Stay current with developments in all Quincy products and offerings
Provide training to customers and sub-distribution
Achieve Business Plan sales goals in Quincy Business categories including small and large rotaries, reciprocating compressors, accessories and aftermarket servicesEducation and Experience:
Bachelor Degree in Engineering preferred; degree in Business, Marketing or Management considered with supplemental technical training or experience
2 - 5 years Compressor Industry experience preferred
Extremely proficient in Excel, Salesforce (CRM), and database managementJob Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
General knowledge of industrial products including compressed air products and markets, including but not limited to air compressors, vacuum pumps and air treatment
Ability to create and manage marketing plans and strategies
Exceptional communication skills, self-motivated, self-starter
Must be able to meet customer-specific requirements for site access.
Training Requirements:
General Safety TrainingPhysical Demands:
Required to be able to move about the facility (standing, walking) and customer sites, varying by location.Personal Protective Equipment:
While in warehouse or workshop area, must wear safety glasses and steel toed shoes at all times. Must comply with all Company PPE policies as directed.
While at customer locations, must comply with Company PPE policies as a minimum, and customer PPE policies as directed.Work Environment:
Mainly a field environment, with significant exposure to customers’ varying manufacturing environments.MAY BE REQUIRED TO PERFORM OTHER DUTIES AS REQUESTED, DIRECTED, OR ASSIGNED.

Indianapolis, IN5+ years experienceCompany Overview
Lennox International (LII) is a leading global provider of innovative climate control solutions for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACR) markets.
Beginning over a century ago, Lennox International has built a strong heritage of Innovation and Responsibility. Our position as an innovation leader continually inspires us to promote more efficient energy use and a healthier environment through our product operations. Our engaged and diverse workforce is committed to providing climate control solutions that provide the most value and comfort for our customers.

We are proud to have instilled a shared sense of responsibility and commitment among our approximately 10,000 employees located throughout North America, South America, Europe, Asia, and Australia.
Job Description
Under limited supervision, responsible for generating total company system specifications by developing a consultative relationship with specifying engineers, a limited group of select design-build commercial contractors, consultants and/or Facility Management teams.
Calls on engineers, selected design build contractors and/or End Users facility managers to obtain total system specifications. Provides a high level application and system selection support. Assists consulting engineers, selected design/build contractors, design firms, and/or End Users to understand the full range of existing and future products and services. Conducts product introduction meetings and product training. Provides expertise on application and system design of specialty products. Communicates Federal, State and Local code compliance requirements and ASHRAE design guidelines. Provides early identification of changing customer and market area requirements; identifying trends, opportunities and threats to the business. Establishes and nurtures a viable partnership with the existing engineering firms, contractors, Sales force, and OEM customers.
Qualifications
Requires a bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Requires at least 5 years related experience.
Ability to communicate effectively with the mechanical engineering community to drive total company system specifications. Excellent verbal and written communication , presentation and training skills. Sales oriented and team focused. Must have Substantial industry and product knowledge. Requires expert abilities in building relationships, listening, persuading, negotiating and managing time. Broad knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services. This includes marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems. Broad knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Customer Relationship Management Software.

Louisville, KY 40213Who we are
Johnson Controls is a $35 Billion multinational conglomerate with 120,000 employees in more than 2,000 locations across six continents. We are the industry leader in Building Products & Technologies, Integrated Solutions and Energy Storage. At Johnson Controls, we’re shaping the future to create a world that’s safe, comfortable and sustainable. Our global team creates innovative, integrated solutions to make cities more connected, buildings more intelligent and vehicles more efficient. We are passionate about improving the way the world lives, works and plays. The future requires bold ideas, an entrepreneurial mind-set and collaboration across boundaries. You need a career focused on tomorrow. Tomorrow needs you.
What we offer
Competitive salary, bonus, benefits plan including medical, dental, vision, prescription coverage, flexible spending accounts, paid life insurance, 401k with great company match, STD, LTD, extensive paid holidays, ongoing training, tuition reimbursement and more. Being a part of a global company like Johnson Controls affords you exposure to global career pathing opportunities.
What you will do

A Systems Application Engineer is part of our Building Technologies & Solutions business at Johnson Controls. This position is based in our Lexington, KY office and serves our existing territory in Lexington, KY. We are continually growing and adding a new Equipment Systems Application Engineer member to our team.
Under general direction, supports the sales team by assisting with pre-sales and post-sales activities on HVAC equipment project opportunities. Pre-sales activities include system configuration, HVAC equipment and/or controls selection for Basis of Design as well as bidding, application and pricing. This role will receive direction, coaching and support from assigned account executives and sales leadership on pre-sale needs and expectations.
Post-sales activities include equipment project execution that is profitable, accurate, on-time, within the scope of the contract and in alignment with customer expectations. Develops and provides detailed engineering information and submittals to communicate design, configuration, operating and installation requirements to customers, consultants, Johnson Controls internal groups and subcontractors. Works with assigned sales team to maintain an effective balance between customer satisfaction and project financial results when performing pre-sale and/or post-sale duties.How you will do itProvide technical support, selections and estimating support to Salespeople during project design or proposal phase. Assists as needed in developing the customer business case for the conceptual solution.Performs and supports detailed estimating of projects for Salespeople to finalize and present to clients. Builds a detailed cost estimate and scope of work for assigned projects in conjunction with Sales. Assists in preparing proposals and other customer communication documents.Prepares customer proposals and quote letters for assigned projects. Includes project takeoffs, specification review, special quote generation and RFQ and RFI issuance.Supports Salespeople’s efforts to become Basis of Design through timely selections, specifications, sequences, drawings and review of documents as required.Manages project Profit and Loss (P&L) and customer satisfaction for all projects assigned. Accomplishes this utilizing the Johnson Controls equipment order execution process, including; execution of the equipment orders and startup.Interprets engineering drawings and specifications in order to develop and provide engineered equipment submittals in compliance with; contract drawing, site coordination, and site installation requirements.Follows standardized submittal generation guidelines for preparation and processing of equipment engineering submittals, including but not limited to; final coil selection, coil hand coordination, fan selection, chiller performance verification, chiller configuration and option selection so as to match schedule, drawing and specification requirements.Verifies that Johnson Controls has an “approved” equipment submittal and positive configuration acceptance by the installing contractor prior to releasing equipment for fabrication.Coordinates the factory equipment order process to ensure technical and commercial compliance with contract documents and site coordination requirements.Generates technical content of Purchase Orders for field purchased materials and equipment.Selects, orders, and tracks the delivery of materials and equipment for assigned projects. Coordinates shipping processes to meet factory and project schedule requirements and reviews the equipment order status reports as needed, identifying any critical delivery requirements. Coordinates equipment delivery requirements with the Customer.Effectively communicates project progress, issues and financial status to management as required. Works closely with branch administration to manage and forecast execution of equipment projects.Coordinates post shipment services that include but are not limited to; start-up initiation, owner training and solutions to delivery, shipping or scope omission problems.Visits customer sites to ensure delivery and receipt of critical equipment is in compliance with the expectations of Johnson Controls, the customer and the owner, if required.Works with Customer Operations Associate to address any billing and collections issues, and to assure Johnson Controls receives payment in full.Develops and maintains viable long-term relationships with customers, consultants, prime contractors and subcontractors. Attends job progress meetings as required.
Qualifications

What we look forBachelor’s degree in EngineeringPrevious experience preferred, but not required, in HVAC Pre-sales activities; system configuration, HVAC equipment selection for Basis of Design, as well as bidding, application and pricingWilling to train the right candidate, as this position can also be an early career development role for the right individualComputer skills experience to include: Microsoft Office suite, (with emphasis on Word, Excel and Visio) Adobe Writer, and basic Windows operating system environmentGood organizational skills with attention to detailInterpersonal skills to effectively communicate with both external and internal customersDemonstrated ability to simultaneously manage a large and diverse number of projects with professionalism, cooperation, and persistence
Johnson Controls is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/tomorrowneedsyou.

job_title: Sales Engineer – Controls Graduate Training Program – Alabama/Georgia
job_description:
Birmingham, AL 352205+ months experienceDescription:
At Ingersoll Rand we're passionate about inspiring progress around the world. We advance the quality of life by creating comfortable, sustainable and efficient environments. Our people and our family of brands-includingClub Car®, Ingersoll Rand®,Thermo King®, Trane®, American Standard® Heating & Air Conditioning and ARO® - work together to enhance the quality and comfort of air in homes and buildings; transport and protect food and perishables; and increase industrial productivity and efficiency. We are a global business committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. For more information, visitwww.ingersollrand.com.
Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including individuals with disabilities and United States qualified protected veterans.
Job Summary:
Building on Trane's 90-year legacy of the Graduate Training Program, the Controls Graduate Training Program (CGTP) is designed to prepare Engineers for a rewarding career in Technical Sales for our expanding Energy Services business. The program is specifically geared toward developing Controls Account Managers to sell Trane's Building Advantage portfolio of services and Building Automation Systems (Controls) to commercial and industrial customers. Upon completion of the Controls Graduate Training Program, employees assume responsibilities of a Controls Account Manager in a pre-assigned location.
Held in St. Paul, MN, the CGTP provides intensive technical, business, sales and leadership training, with an emphasis on maintaining the highest ethical and professional standards. Participants will attend lectures and technical presentations; complete challenging homework assignments; partake in individual and team projects; visit local sales offices and plants; learn about real world projects from Trane sales engineers, managers and customers.
Key Elements of the Controls Graduate Training Program include:
Ingersoll Rand and Trane's history and values
Technical focus: HVAC and Controls Fundamentals
HVAC Systems and comprehensive solutions
Controls and Energy Services offeringsEnvironmental and Energy factors associated with developing HVAC and Building Automation Systems recommendations to meet customer specifications
Networking opportunities with Trane's senior sales engineers and leadership
Sales and leadership development through teamwork and project managementCGTP is a 5 month training program consisting of 14 weeks at the Trane St. Paul Controls Headquarters and 4 weeks of bridge time back in the District Sales Office.
Bridgework in the office is an essential part of the CGTP curriculum designed to help students integrate classroom and experiential learning, and key to organizational development of the Controls Account Manager role.Assignments are a mix of on-line learning, interaction with office cohorts, and assignments given by CGTP instructors.
The opportunity to attend the Controls Graduate Training Program positions students to influence the business in a critical way to become educated change agents for our organization. This selective program provides a strong foundation to start your career in technical sales, or build on your existing experience to take your career in an exciting new direction.
Responsibilities:
Convert leads into opportunities by assigning the appropriate sales process, identifying the required project team members, making assignments, and communicating the next steps in the process
Utilizes account management process to identify key customers and to develop specific action plans to grow identified accounts.
Develops relationships with multiple buying influences in the customer's organization, including project managers, project engineers, construction, purchasing, and accounts payable.
Assists customers in answering technical questions on HVAC systems, Trane products, and system application alternative, Building Automation Systems, installation, operation, maintenance, and problem resolution.
Determines needs, develops and executes an account specific business plan to identify the long term, mutual support requirements required to facilitate a strong, profitable and successful partnership.
Gathers and validates preliminary information and performs facility walkthrough, construction plan review or other requirements.
Determines project needs, constraints, and responsibilities to meet all of the customer's HVAC system design and installation requirements.
Responsible for project take-off, selection, pricing, and integration of equipment, controls, and services.Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have obtained or are currently pursuing a Bachelor's of Science in Engineering, Information Technology Systems, or technology related field
Strong oral and written communication skills with desire to impact organization revenue through sales
Strong goal orientation, highly motivated, and possess a strong desire to sell industry leading products in the market place.
Eligible for employment in the United States without sponsorship
Possess a valid state issued Driver's License with ability to provide proof of insurance and meet our successful background check requirement.
Flexibility to work outside normal work hours, as required.We are committed to helping you reach your professional, personal and financial goals. We offer competitive compensation that aligns with our business strategies and comprehensive benefits to help you live your healthiest. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture that engages as well as values the different backgrounds and experiences of our employee, which, in turn, spurs innovation, generates creative solutions and enhances our customer relations.
If you share our passion for inspiring progress-for bringing about bold shifts in how people, economies and societies operate-then you belong with Ingersoll Rand. Progress begins with you.

Jackson, MS4+ years experienceImmediate position opening for an experienced pre-sales solutions architect, supporting a growing services and solutions company. The solutions architect will be responsible for providing technical presales support for the company’s sales team.

Objectives:
Provide high-level technical support through company’s services sales, helping drive revenue
Present and explain company’s products, services and capabilities to customers and prospective customers
Provide technical support and training to company’s sales team
Initiate and drive enhancements to existing solutions and participation in the creation of new product offerings
Collaborate with Practice Directors and field engineers to insure success of customer solutions
Responsibilities:
Understand customer technology needs and provide designs for solutions including: managed networks, cloud computing, unified communications, storage, virtualization, wireless, security, mobility and professional services
Assist sales team in professionally and effectively presenting proposed solutions and designs to customers and prospects in a varied business settings
Lead discussions, consulting with company practice directors in validating proposed solutions
Perform effective time management throughout short and long term customer/partner support activities
Compose and provide thorough and accurate bill of materials, professional services requirements and assist sales team with the quotation process
Develop and grow the company’s technical knowledge base, including: managed networks, cloud computing, unified communications, storage, virtualization, wireless, security, mobility, application management and professional services
Provide technical information and training to new and existing sales team members
Assist with the accomplishment of revenue and gross profit targets, working closely with the sales team throughout the sales cycle
Actively participate in company’s product and service development by working to better serve customer needs and how current products, features and services might be enhanced or transformed into new or better product and service offerings.
Work to ensure policies and procedures compliance
Required Skills:
Demonstrated understanding of the technology and architecture of: managed networks, cloud computing, unified communications, storage, virtualization, wireless, security, mobility and professional services
Proficiency in use of office applications, including: MS Outlook, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint
Exemplary organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
Ability to effectively perform and create detailed documentation for customer needs assessments
Experience in the design, build and implementation of successful and effective customer solutions based on customer needs assessments
Capability and readiness to document technical solutions in a timely manner while ensuring feasibility, reliability, accuracy, and completeness
Capability and readiness to work in a team environment, sharing knowledge and expertise amongvarious departments within the company
Experienced in successfully meeting tight deadlines while managing variable workloads in addition to unexpected challenges and priority changes.
Desired Skills:
Knowledge and minimum four years of applied work experience in one or more of the following: managed networks, cloud computing, unified communications, storage, virtualization, wireless, security, mobility and professional services
Knowledge and minimum two years of applied work experience in the design of distributed, high availability network infrastructures, including servers, switches, routers, and storage
Knowledge and minimum two years of practical work experience in the configuration and support of VMware and Microsoft Exchange
Data center facilities and environments experience and familiarity with security, HVAC equipment, switching systems, fire suppression systems, cabling and cable management
Preferred knowledge of Cisco, EMC, VMWare, Microsoft, NetApp, Fortinet and Juniper Networks
Education or Equivalent Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/MIS/Computer Science or equivalent work experience
4 to 7 years of experience as a sales/pre-sales engineer, solutions engineer, data center engineer, or related operational engineering role

Columbia, MD 21046SUMMARY
The Senior Applications Engineer will assist Havtech’s Estimating Department by providing technical support for the Equipment Sales Team and clients in both the acquisition and fulfillment stages of equipment projects. This requires a unique
combination of customer service skills to influence the design and purchase of commercial HVAC systems, problem solving skills to ensure accurate equipment delivery and drive to accomplish other specific objectives in a given time frame with limited resources.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other functions may be assigned.Responsible for the take-off, optimization/validation of the equipment to include selection of size, configuration, voltage, options, etc. of the HVAC equipment by reviewing the plans and specifications.
Ability to deal with complex projects/situations and the ability to work independently with little guidance.
Prepares proposals and pricing break downs while evaluating equipment savings and seen as the subject material expert to the team.
Stays current with material costs to address escalation during budgeting phase.
The ability to handle numerous multi-million dollar estimates per month along with assisting other Applications Engineers as needed with guidance and direction on complex jobs.
Ability to use computer skills to facilitate improvement of estimating systems and selection of software.
Assists with training other Applications Engineers on selection software as needed.
Demonstrates advanced product knowledge and the ability to support the training and onboarding of new hires.
Develops and maintains strong relationships with represented manufacturers,maintains competitive advantage and stays abreast of industry trends.
Builds strong relationships with internal customers such as Havtech Parts, Havtech Service and Spectrum Energy.
Assists with auditing jobs to identify training opportunities and provide feedback to management and Applications Engineers.
Assists with identifying best practices to help improve estimating processes throughout the department alongside the Estimating Process Expert.
Advanced high level of Product Knowledge in HVAC Equipment/Products.
Identifies customer needs to facilitate proposal and pricing summary generation.
Communicates with subcontractors and suppliers by obtaining prices with vendors for materials and evaluates vendor proposals.
Documents work by maintaining electronic files for each job including, but not limited to, internal and external customer correspondence to mitigate project risk.
Responsible for holding job meetings such as; cost reviews and pre-bid strategy meetings.
Simultaneously handles a large and diverse number of projects and issues with tact, cooperation and persistence.
Ability to foster and build relationships with Sales Engineers to facilitate estimating excellence.
Ability to resolve bid issues/discrepancies with tact and provide lessons learned to improve overall performance of the department.
Flexibility to work outside normal work hours, as required.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESThis position has no supervisory responsibilities.QUALIFICATIONS include the following:Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Construction, or other related areas required.
Six (6) to Seven (7) years of experience in the HVAC industry required; experience performing HVAC related project management, estimating or sales responsibilities strongly preferred.
Or an equivalent combination of the above education and work experience.
Advanced knowledge of HVAC industry performing Project Manager, Estimator or Sales Engineer roles preferred.
Must have basic PC experience in Windows environment, working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook), Web-enabled applications and intermediate level experience with Excel.
Must possess excellent math aptitude, superior follow-up skills and ability to work under pressure.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills are required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and walk. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential
functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.DECLARATIONHuman Resources retains the sole right and discretion to make changes to this job description.
Any employee making changes unauthorized by the Vice President or Human Resources will be subject to disciplinary action up to and including termination.

Blauvelt, NY2+ years experienceSUMMARY

Manages international product portfolio with product managers of AERCO & PVI brands to comply with various international codes, standards, and requirements. Works with international partners to schedule and execute sales and promotional activities in the various regions. Processes requests for information, responds to inquiries, and generates quotations and orders for export sales. Supports global Watts Heat and Hot Water Solutions Sales teams.

Participates in the planning of international business including the development of international short and long-term plans and programs to meet the international sales goals of the Company. Implements and executes approved plans.
Work with Product Management and Engineering to adapt US products to comply with international codes and applications.
Creates technical marketing collateral for target international regions including overseeing translation projects, competitive comparisons, and educational white papers.
Engineer solutions for customers based on their specific project requirements and goals and act as a consultant to generate optimal system designs.
Provide packaged quotations to customers and process RFI/RFQ to support international sales.
Coordinates international patent and trademark registrations.
Coordinates license arrangements for Company's products with regulatory team.
Maintains knowledge of plant's processes, techniques, tools, materials, machines and equipment.
Acts as a liaison to Global teams in support of Strategic Accounts Messaging.

No Supervisory Responsibilities

Fluency in foreign language(s) a plus.
Ability to effectively present products to large and small groups.
Awareness of global cultural differences and the communication skills necessary to effectively interact with coworkers and outside contacts.

BA/BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or related area.
2 to 4 years experience in HVAC / Plumbing system design
Experience with international customers and projects preferred.

 Approx. 40% international travel required.

Frederick, MD2+ years experienceThe Solution Sales Application Engineer will work closely with HVAC representatives throughout North America making equipment selections, performance, pricing and submittals.

The primary function of the position is to provide product solution engineering support to AboveAir rep force. The ability to communicate both verbal and written, suggest alternatives and provide technical data are only some of the multi-tasking requirements. The successful candidate will utilize both business and technical expertise to provide equipment solutions for individual projects. This position will require organizational skills to manage multiple projects and respond in a timely manner to product requests.

Job Description:
Provide system unit design, performance and pricing assistance.
Review drawings, schedules and performance requirements for applications.
Assist in specification review and if necessary, provide alternative recommendations.
Review project order documentation for accuracy.
Produce submittals and other documents for engineering approval.
Qualifications:
BSME required.
2 years or more HVAC experience.
Experience in fan performance, heat transfer technology, air and water cooled equipment.
Experience with Outside Air and Mission Critical equipment technologies.
Experience working with sales reps and consulting engineers preferred.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and CAD.
High level of creativity and problem solving.
Ability to demonstrate conduct by conforming to a set of values and accepted standards.
Ability to multi-task and meet time sensitive material requirements.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Strong organizational and communication skills are required.
Excellent Benefits
AboveAir Technologies offers a comprehensive benefits package including:
Medical, Dental and Prescription
401(k) with Company Match
Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance
Paid Vacations/Holidays
Educational Assistance
Company Sponsored Events
AboveAir Technologies is an equal opportunity employer.

Conyers, GA 300133+ years experienceHillphoenix is a leading manufacturer of Display Cases, Specialty Products, Refrigeration Systems, Power Systems and Comprehensive Services. The story of Hillphoenix is built on creativity and customer-centric innovation delivered by people invigorated by a strong sense of responsibility to help our customers win in their marketplaces. The relationships we build with our customers are as important to our success as the products we manufacture. This collaborative environment delivers FRESH THINKING, reassuring our customers that they choose the best when they choose to work with the people of Hillphoenix. Hillphoenix is part of the Refrigeration and Food Equipment segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer with annual revenues in excess of $7 billion.
Job Title: Inside Sales Application Engineer - Refrigeration
FLSA Status: Salaried Exempt / Full-time
Location: Conyers, Georgia
Department: Engineering - Systems Division
Supervisor: Inside Sales Engineering Manager
Salary Range: Salary commensurate with experience and qualifications
Summary:
This position is responsible for designing and applying highly customizable products to meet the customer’s refrigeration equipment requirement. This position also acts as a project manager managing customer accounts from the quoting through installation phase. This position performs a variety of engineering functions involving close customer contact for equipment engineering design, pricing, delivery and installation.
Responsibilities & Duties:
Work with Consulting engineers, customers and/or Outside Sales to determine requirements and specifications for jobs to be designed.
Generates refrigeration legends sheets / specifications using proprietary software
Calculates refrigeration requirements based on display case manufacturer’s requirements
Calculates refrigerated walk in cooler / freezer refrigeration requirements
Determines proper system/equipment type to meet the customer’s needs
Selects proper compressors, condensers, evaporators, controls and other accessories to satisfy the refrigeration requirements
Calculates the price of the quotation based on the job requirements and competitive situation
Receives and processes orders for manufacturing
Works with other departments to ensure that the project is properly processed through finance, materials group, production engineering and manufacturing
Assist in trouble shooting and resolution of issues after the equipment has been delivered.
Work with the shipping department to assist customer with any related issues
Work with contractors and engineering consultants in order to promote and apply products to meet the demand.
Assist customers with remodel requirements, suggesting new equipment and/or field modifications to meet the customer’s demands
 Qualifications:
Associates or Bachelor’s degree in engineering or business preferred.
3-5 years’ experience within the refrigeration industry.
Additional Skills & Experience:
Working knowledge of refrigeration systems, basic understanding of the refrigeration cycle and components used on supermarket refrigeration systems.
Ability to use Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook) applications to at least an advanced beginner to intermediate level.
Lean/Six Sigma Green Belt preferred.
Ability to quickly adapt in a fast-paced high-energy environment.
The ability to demonstrate independence, dependability and flexibility to manage work as required.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.

job_title: Sales Engineer - Controls Graduate Training Program - Oregon, Washington
job_description:
Bellevue, WA 980055+ months experienceDescription:
At Ingersoll Rand we're passionate about inspiring progress around the world. We advance the quality of life by creating comfortable, sustainable and efficient environments. Our people and our family of brands-includingClub Car®, Ingersoll Rand®,Thermo King®, Trane®, American Standard® Heating & Air Conditioning and ARO® - work together to enhance the quality and comfort of air in homes and buildings; transport and protect food and perishables; and increase industrial productivity and efficiency. We are a global business committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. For more information, visitwww.ingersollrand.com.
Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including individuals with disabilities and United States qualified protected veterans.
Job Summary:
Building on Trane's 90-year legacy of the Graduate Training Program, the Controls Graduate Training Program (CGTP) is designed to prepare Engineers for a rewarding career in Technical Sales for our expanding Energy Services business. The program is specifically geared toward developing Controls Account Managers to sell Trane's Building Advantage portfolio of services and Building Automation Systems (Controls) to commercial and industrial customers. Upon completion of the Controls Graduate Training Program, employees assume responsibilities of a Controls Account Manager in a pre-assigned location.
Held in St. Paul, MN, the CGTP provides intensive technical, business, sales and leadership training, with an emphasis on maintaining the highest ethical and professional standards. Participants will attend lectures and technical presentations; complete challenging homework assignments; partake in individual and team projects; visit local sales offices and plants; learn about real world projects from Trane sales engineers, managers and customers.
Key Elements of the Controls Graduate Training Program include:
Ingersoll Rand and Trane's history and values
Technical focus: HVAC and Controls Fundamentals
HVAC Systems and comprehensive solutions
Controls and Energy Services offeringsEnvironmental and Energy factors associated with developing HVAC and Building Automation Systems recommendations to meet customer specifications
Networking opportunities with Trane's senior sales engineers and leadership
Sales and leadership development through teamwork and project managementCGTP is a 5 month training program consisting of 14 weeks at the Trane St. Paul Controls Headquarters and 4 weeks of bridge time back in the District Sales Office.
Bridgework in the office is an essential part of the CGTP curriculum designed to help students integrate classroom and experiential learning, and key to organizational development of the Controls Account Manager role.Assignments are a mix of on-line learning, interaction with office cohorts, and assignments given by CGTP instructors.
The opportunity to attend the Controls Graduate Training Program positions students to influence the business in a critical way to become educated change agents for our organization. This selective program provides a strong foundation to start your career in technical sales, or build on your existing experience to take your career in an exciting new direction.
Responsibilities:
Convert leads into opportunities by assigning the appropriate sales process, identifying the required project team members, making assignments, and communicating the next steps in the process
Utilizes account management process to identify key customers and to develop specific action plans to grow identified accounts.
Develops relationships with multiple buying influences in the customer's organization, including project managers, project engineers, construction, purchasing, and accounts payable.
Assists customers in answering technical questions on HVAC systems, Trane products, and system application alternative, Building Automation Systems, installation, operation, maintenance, and problem resolution.
Determines needs, develops and executes an account specific business plan to identify the long term, mutual support requirements required to facilitate a strong, profitable and successful partnership.
Gathers and validates preliminary information and performs facility walkthrough, construction plan review or other requirements.
Determines project needs, constraints, and responsibilities to meet all of the customer's HVAC system design and installation requirements.
Responsible for project take-off, selection, pricing, and integration of equipment, controls, and services.Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have obtained or are currently pursuing a Bachelor's of Science in Engineering, Information Technology Systems, or technology related field
Strong oral and written communication skills with desire to impact organization revenue through sales
Strong goal orientation, highly motivated, and possess a strong desire to sell industry leading products in the market place.
Eligible for employment in the United States without sponsorship
Possess a valid state issued Driver's License with ability to provide proof of insurance and meet our successful background check requirement.
Flexibility to work outside normal work hours, as required.We are committed to helping you reach your professional, personal and financial goals. We offer competitive compensation that aligns with our business strategies and comprehensive benefits to help you live your healthiest. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture that engages as well as values the different backgrounds and experiences of our employee, which, in turn, spurs innovation, generates creative solutions and enhances our customer relations.
If you share our passion for inspiring progress-for bringing about bold shifts in how people, economies and societies operate-then you belong with Ingersoll Rand. Progress begins with you.

Job Summary:
Trane's summer internship allows participants to experience a program focused on exploring a career in Technical Sales. Our commercial business systems interns work with Industry leading Sales Professionals and our customers in the design, application and sale of systems, controls, parts and services for commercial, industrial and institutional buildings. This includes the world's most complete line of commercial, industrial and institutional heating, ventilating and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment and building management controls. Throughout your internship at one of our nationwide sales offices, you will be exposed to the many facets of Trane's businesses: Service, Equipment, Building Automation, Application, Fulfillment and much more. You will attend sales meetings; business functions; sales and service calls; customer meetings alongside experienced account managers and mentors. You will understand the steps sales engineers take from start to finish on a job and will be hands-on in those steps throughout the internship. In addition, you will gain an appreciation for the importance of the relationship with our customers as you work with them on a daily basis as a point-of-contact creating a sense of ownership and importance in the solution-making process. Our structured twelve-week (12) program will challenge and develop your technical, business, sales, leadership and communication skills. It will give you insight into sales engineering career with Trane and create the opportunity to join our industry leading Graduate Training Program (GTP) upon graduation for those who mutually agree to pursue a career in Technical Sales.

Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree

Glendale, CA1+ years experienceOur Sales team is a turbocharged V12 engine that drives the entire company forward by bringing our software platform to new customers - every single day. We are a tight-knit, high-energy crew that comprises Sales Development, Account Executives, and Sales Operations. We have a shared passion for helping residential contractors take their business to the next level, and nothing makes our team happier than seeing stellar feedback from customers who have had the opportunity to leverage ServiceTitan.

Adoption Sales Engineer

Ideal Sales Engineer (SE) candidate must be a hungry self starter with a proven track record in SaaS Sales and knowledge of technology. Must be able to explain complex information and concepts in simple to understand and practical business context. The candidate will be organized and analytical, able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches. Must possess strong presentation skills and be able to communicate professionally verbally as well as in written communication.
What you'll do:Support sales efforts in client-facing meetings and calls by leading custom product demonstrations based on a solid understanding of customer business processes and workflows
Support efforts to Up-sell current customers on additional ServiceTitan products to drive increased recurring revenue.
Marry technical expertise, product knowledge, and industry knowledge with Sales Acumen in order to help close business and thoroughly educate customers on the product
Offer creative solutions to complex workflows against specific business requirements
Provide clear documentation and approach for delivery to the implementation team
Intimately learn industry and use cases for ServiceTitan for a Home Services Business; Background in Home Services a plus
Maintain a general understanding of the competitive landscape and be able to articulate and demonstrate why ServiceTitan's product is the best-in-class solution for the service industry
Responsible for representing the product to customers and at field events such as conferences, seminars, etc.
Maintain and enhance industry-specific demo environments and scripts for use by internal teams
Responsible for understanding Product Roadmap and be able to speak eloquently to upcoming releases and implications for business owner
Able to respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
Able to convey customer requirements to Product Management teams and relay information to Sales Team
Ability to reposition customer objections and explain workarounds for workflows not inherent within ST
What you'll need:1-2 Years in Sales Engineer Role at a SaaS company
Proven track record of success at previous companies
Experience and familiarity of our products and line of business a plus
Strong background in Telecom and/or Marketing a plus
A B.S. in Computer Science or a related field preferred

About ServiceTitan

ServiceTitan is a mobile, cloud-based software platform that helps home services companies streamline operations, improve customer service, and grow their business. ServiceTitan's end-to-end solution for the multi-billion dollar residential home services industry includes CRM, intelligent dispatch, custom reporting, marketing automation, mobile solution for field techs, and accounting integration with Intacct and QuickBooks. ServiceTitan brings a fully operational modern SaaS infrastructure to an industry traditionally underserved by software. ServiceTitan is the preferred software for hundreds of the world's most successful plumbing, HVAC, and electrical companies. For more information about ServiceTitan, visit www.ServiceTitan.com.
